title: Mandana Karimi speaks out about her decision to quit acting: It’s hard to say no to money but… - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mandana Karimi speaks out about her decision to quit acting: It’s hard to say no to money but…

Date: January 19, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Iranian actor-model Mandana Karimi has decided to leave acting behind to pursue a career in interior design and academia, stating that she never truly loved acting.

  • Mandana gained fame from Bigg Boss 9 and movies like Kya Kool Hai Hum 3.
  • She has been turning down all acting and modeling offers for nearly a year.
  • Karimi is now focusing on interior design and works as a visiting professor at various institutes.
  • She expresses gratitude for her acting career but indicates it was not a passion.
  • Karimi acknowledges the difficulty of saying no to money from acting roles.
  • She enjoys her new routine, balancing work and school.
“Acting was a job that I never loved, nor this industry. I am grateful for the time I spent there, but it wasn't something I was hungry for or crazy about.”

Mandana’s shift from acting to academia highlights her pursuit of passion and fulfillment over financial gain.
newTitle: Mandana Karimi speaks out about her decision to quit acting: It’s hard to say no to money but…

summary:
Coldplay's Chris Martin Gives Shoutout to Jasprit Bumrah During Concert

Publication Date: Jan 19, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

During Coldplay's concert at Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, lead singer Chris Martin delightfully acknowledged India's star bowler Jasprit Bumrah, amusing fans and prompting cheers from the crowd.

  • Chris Martin interrupted the performance of 'Sky Full Of Stars' to mention Bumrah, prompting enthusiasm from the audience.
  • He humorously claimed that Bumrah wanted to bowl at him backstage, eliciting laughter and applause.
  • Bumrah has been named in India's Champions Trophy squad but is currently recovering from back spasms.
  • Chief selector Ajit Agarkar mentioned that Bumrah's fitness will be reassessed in early February.
“Hold on, we have to finish the show because Jasprit Bumrah wants to come and play backstage.”

This lighthearted interaction underscored the intertwining of sports and music culture in India, resonating well with fans of both domains.
newTitle: Coldplay's Chris Martin Gives Shoutout to Jasprit Bumrah During Concert

title: Saif Ali Khan stabbing: Main accused arrested; used to work at Mumbai pub | Details so far - Hindustan Times
summary:
Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Main Accused Arrested

Date: January 19, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Mumbai Police have arrested Vijay Das, the main accused in the stabbing of actor Saif Ali Khan during a robbery attempt at his home. The incident occurred in the early hours of Thursday, leaving Khan with six stab wounds.

  • The accused previously worked at a pub in Mumbai and has multiple aliases.
  • The attack was captured on CCTV, showing the intruder entering Khan's apartment.
  • Khan's son rushed him to the hospital after the attack, where he underwent several surgeries.
  • The assailant was later seen on CCTV buying headphones hours after the attack.
“He is completely cheerful. In fact, we are planning a discharge in the next two to three days.” - Dr. Niraj Uttamani, Chief Operating Officer, Lilavati Hospital

Saif Ali Khan is reported to be recovering well and is likely to be discharged soon.
newTitle: Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Main Accused Arrested

Published On: Jan 19, 2025

Source: Zinia Bandyopadhyay

After five months of perfecting their sur-taal through relentless riyaaz and delivering mesmerising performances, Mumbai girl Shradha Mishra was crowned the season’s winner of Sa Re Ga Ma Pa, defeating Subhasree Debnath and Ujwal Motiram Gajbhar.

  • Shradha Mishra lifted the trophy amidst thunderous applause.
  • Finalists Subhasree Debnath and Ujwal Motiram Gajbhar were the runners-up.
  • Mentors included Sachin-Jigar, Sachet-Parampara, and Guru Randhawa.
  • The finale featured performances from legendary singers like Udit Narayan and Kavita Krishnamurti.
  • Shradha reflected on her journey and the release of her original single 'Dhokebazi.'
This is a dream come true for me. My journey on Sa Re Ga Ma Pa has been a transformative learning experience, thanks to the constant support and guidance of my mentors. - Shradha Mishra

title: Saif Ali Khan stabbing news: How railway police zeroed in on suspect in train - Hindustan Times
summary:
Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Suspect Detained by Railway Police

Date & Source: Jan 18, 2025, Hindustan Times

The Railway Protection Force (RPF) detained a suspect in the Saif Ali Khan stabbing case while he was travelling by the Jnaneswari Express train in Durg district, Chhattisgarh.

  • The suspect, Aakash Kanojia, was located using information from the Mumbai police.
  • Kanojia was apprehended in the train's general coach based on a photo and tower location provided by the Mumbai police.
  • Saif Ali Khan was attacked in his home, resulting in multiple stab wounds.
  • He was treated at Lilavati Hospital and is reported to be out of danger.
  • The Mumbai police have assembled over 20 teams to find the intruder who attacked Khan.
"The suspect's identity was confirmed through a video call with Mumbai Police. He has been detained. Further interrogation will be done by Mumbai Police." - Sanjay Sinha, RPF in-charge at Durg

The swift action by the RPF showcases the effective collaboration between state police forces in the wake of a serious incident involving a public figure.
newTitle: Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Suspect Detained by Railway Police

title: Emergency box office collection day 2: Kangana Ranaut’s film mints over ₹5 crore - Hindustan Times
summary:
Emergency box office collection day 2: Kangana Ranaut's maiden solo directorial also stars late Satish Kaushik, Shreyas Talpade, and Anupam Kher.

Date: Jan 18, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Kangana Ranaut's long-delayed solo directorial 'Emergency' hit theaters on January 17 and has seen an increase in box office collection, earning over ₹5 crore in its second day.

  • The film began with a low opening, grossing ₹2.35 crore on its first day.
  • On the second day, it earned ₹3.04 crore, totaling ₹5.54 crore.
  • The film has an overall occupancy of 13.32% in Hindi screenings.
  • 'Emergency' is a biographical thriller focusing on the life of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.
  • The cast includes notable actors such as Anupam Kher and Shreyas Talpade.
“The political thriller begins by tracking the events that led to the imposition of the Emergency in India in 1975.”

This film marks a significant moment for Kangana Ranaut as it showcases her directorial debut and is garnering attention for its portrayal of historical events.
newTitle: Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency' Earns Over ₹5 Crore on Second Day

summary:

Introduction: Kangana Ranaut's political drama 'Emergency' has experienced a great start at the box office, collecting Rs 6 crores over its first two days, aided by positive word of mouth.

  • The film earned Rs 3.50 crores on Saturday after an opening day collection of Rs 2.50 crores.
